page.title: 19Clinterty House
page.content: {Clinterty House}was built in 1920. Behind the house are derelict quarries. It is five miles out of Aberdeen. It was owned by the Hays of Seaton. The house was later inherited by his son who married a French lady. A farmer later became the owner, but sold it to a doctor. He then rented it out to students, [REDACTED] finally it was split up into three different houses in the 1970's. The people who live there now moved there because of the oil and the Airport. All three owners have transport because it would be difficult without it, as the nearest shop is two miles away. They don't have much entertainment, just an occasional visit to the theatre or cinema, and they would be lost without the television or the telephone.
